member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor
member.summary: A COM interop wrapper for the ISensor interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetID(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Unique ID of sensor within the sensors platform
member.param: The unique ID to be returned

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetCategory(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Category of sensor Ex: Location
member.param: The sensor category to be returned

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetType(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Specific type of sensor: Ex: IPLocationSensor
member.param: The sensor Type to be returned

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetFriendlyName(System.String@)
member.summary: Human readable name for sensor
member.param: The friendly name for the sensor

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetProperty(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyKey@,MS.WindowsAPICodePack.Internal.PropVariant)
member.summary: Sensor metadata: make, model, serial number, etc
member.param: The PROPERTYKEY for the property to be retrieved
The property returned

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetProperties(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceKeyCollection,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues@)
member.summary: Bulk Sensor metadata query: make, model, serial number, etc
member.param: The PROPERTYKEY collection for the properties to be retrieved
The properties returned

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetSupportedDataFields(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceKeyCollection@)
member.summary: Get the array of SensorDataField objects that describe the individual values that can be reported by the sensor
member.param: A collection of PROPERTYKEY structures representing the data values reported by the sensor

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.SetProperties(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues@)
member.summary: Bulk Sensor metadata set for settable properties
member.param: The properties to be set
The PROPERTYKEY/HRESULT pairs indicating success/failure for each property set

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.SupportsDataField(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Shell.PropertySystem.PropertyKey,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Reports whether or not a sensor can deliver the requested data type
member.param: The GUID to find matching PROPERTYKEY structures for
A collection of PROPERTYKEY structures representing the data values

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.SupportsEvent(System.Guid,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Reports whether or not a sensor supports the specified event.
member.param: The event identifier
true if the event is supported, otherwise false

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.ISensor.GetEventInterest(System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32@)

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceKeyCollection
member.summary: Holds a collection of PROPERTYKEY values. This interface can be retrieved from a method or, if a new object is required, call CoCreate with CLSID_PortableDeviceKeyCollection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues
member.summary: The nativeIPortableDeviceValues interface holds a collection of PROPERTYKEY/PropVariant pairs. Values in the collection do not need to be all the same VARTYPE. Values are stored as key-value pairs; each key must be unique in the collection. Clients can search for items by PROPERTYKEY or zero-based index. Data values are stored as PropVariant structures. You can add or retrieve values of any type by using the generic methods SetValue and GetValue, or you add items by using the method specific to the type of data added.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection
member.summary: Holds a collection of indexed nativeIPortableDeviceValues interfaces. This interface can be retrieved from a method, or if a new object is required, call CoCreate with CLSID_PortableDeviceValuesCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.GetCount(System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the number of items in the collection.
member.param: Pointer to a DWORD that contains the number of nativeIPortableDeviceValues interfaces in the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.GetAt(System.UInt32,Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues@)
member.summary: Retrieves an item from the collection by a zero-based index.
member.param: DWORD that specifies a zero-based index in the collection.
Address of a variable that receives a pointer to an nativeIPortableDeviceValues interface from the collection. The caller is responsible for calling Release on this interface when done with it

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.Add(Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues)
member.summary: Adds an item to the collection.
member.param: Pointer to an nativeIPortableDeviceValues interface to add to the collection. The interface is not actually copied, but AddRef is called on it

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.Clear
member.summary: Releases all items from the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.RemoveAt(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes an item from the collection by a zero-based index.
member.param: DWORD that specifies a zero-based index in the collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Sensors.IPortableDevicePropVariantCollection
member.summary: Holds a collection of PropVariant values of the same VARTYPE. The VARTYPE of the first item that is added to the collection determines the VARTYPE of the collection. An attempt to add an item of a different VARTYPE may fail if the PropVariant value cannot be changed to the collection?s current VARTYPE. To change the VARTYPE of the collection manually, call ChangeType
